group_1.narration: < Asunaro City >

group_1.textLeft: Kyubey,@this sensation…!

group_1.textRight: Looks like there’s a Labyrinth nearby.

group_1.textLeft: Found it!
Alright, let’s go!
Transform!

group_1.narration: “It was different from the diary’s accounts,@but it seems that Michiru has successfully@made a contract.”
“No matter how many times it repeats,@she always becomes a Magical Girl…@That is Michiru’s fate…”
“It’s fine that way…@After all, that is the Michiru we know.”
“It is a bit sad…”
“…Despair means a bad end,@tragedy means a good end…@It’s heart wrenching,@regardless of how it turns out.”
“Indeed, the ‘heart’—it’s the key to this tale…@Moving forward, ‘that’ meeting awaits...”

group_1.textRight: Too bad, it looks like it wasn’t a Witch,@just a Familiar.

group_1.textLeft: Familiars attack people too, don’t they…?@Those girls were in real danger.
Are you two okay?

group_1.textRight: One is Kaoru Maki, a middle schooler who was,@quite surprisingly, a member of Japan’s U-18
soccer delegation until her career ended@due to an injury.

group_1.textLeft: The other is Umika Misaki, a middle schooler@and best-selling author
who ended up caught in a set-up plagiarism@scandal.

group_1.textRight: After saving their lives,@Michiru was invited to Umika’s house.
There, she learns of their circumstances, and@leads them into the world of Magical Girls.
Now for the next part of the plot...

group_1.narration: < Umika’s House >
―Michiru―@Ta-da!@Strawberry risotto!
―Umika & Kaoru―@Strawberry risotto…?!

group_1.textRight: I’m sorry,@I had plans to prepare lunch myself.
To make my guest cook instead is…

group_1.textLeft: Don’t worry, I said I wanted to do it,@after all!

group_1.textRight: Woah, I’ve never had this before,@it’s a masterpiece!
Who'd you learn it from?

group_1.textLeft: Thank you.@It was my grandma who taught me.
You had great ingredients,@so I wanted to make it!

group_1.textRight: I see you’re very skilled at cooking.@I like to cook too.

group_1.textLeft: Your kitchen did look super nice, it was full@cookware sets and everything.

group_1.textRight: She was a lot more specific about that than the@workroom when shopping for houses.

group_1.textLeft: This is a pretty fancy mansion, by the way…
You bought this on your own, right, Umika?@But aren’t you a middle schooler…?

group_1.textRight: Umika is a renowned author, after all.

group_1.textLeft: Author?

group_1.textRight: Have a look at that shelf.

group_1.textLeft: …[wait:1.0][chara:401701:lipSynch_1]By Umika Misaki…

group_1.textRight: Umika is a best-selling author.
Well, sort of.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:401701:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Oh, I’ve seen this one at the bookstore@before!
So those trophies over there are the awards@you’ve earned?

group_1.textRight: Those are mine.@I play soccer, you see.
She was selected by a junior delegation,@and even played in world championships.

group_1.textLeft: That’s awesome!@Do you plan on going pro in the future?
Like going to the Italy women’s league?

group_1.textRight: That’s not happening…@I can’t think of the future anymore.

group_1.textLeft: Huh…?

group_1.textRight: Indeed…@Whether tomorrow comes or not,
that’s no longer something we worry about…

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean…?

group_1.narration: “Novelist Misaki Umika under suspicion of plagiarism?!”
“That’s quite a tricky situation…@There are also rumors of the web author coming@forward with the plagiarism accusations…@However, she is the granddaughter of@a member of parliament, so…”
“And so, the company has decided to@recall all of Ms. Misaki’s published works,@as well as cease production on any@future publications.”
“When can Kaoru come back to the team…”
“She’ll undergo surgery for her knee,@but it seems very unlikely…@There've been many players who’ve retired@because of this same injury.”
“Even if she comes back,@she probably won't be able to run like she used to…”

group_1.textLeft: That’s so horrible…

group_1.textRight: …I lost the single most important thing to me.
It would be less painful if I just died…

group_1.textLeft: …You don’t really mean that, do you?

group_1.textRight: Eh…?

group_1.textLeft: The two of you still want to live,@deep down.
After all, you said my strawberry risotto was@delicious!
My food made you lick your plates clean!

group_1.textRight: What do you mean…?

group_1.textLeft: My family…my grandma, she’s no longer here,@but there’s something she used to say…

group_1.narration: “That’s it, very good.”
“Remember, even if it’s expensive,@the strawberries you use must be fresh.@Also, Italian carnaroli is the best pick for the rice.”
“...Whenever hard times come,@and you don’t know what to do,@listen to your stomach.”
“If your belly is empty and you feel hungry,@then that means that you still want to live.”

group_1.textLeft: My grandma taught me that “to eat”…
…means “to keep on living.”

group_1.textRight: She must’ve been a great person…

group_1.textLeft: Yep, to me, she was the greatest person in@the entire world.
But you see, even though I loved her@very much…
I couldn’t say goodbye to her at the very end…
The story I just told you…I couldn’t hear it@from her while she was still here…

group_1.textRight: Then, how…did you hear of it?

group_1.textLeft: I got to meet her again in my dreams,@after she had passed.
In exchange for a duty I have to fulfill…
I got to have that one miracle granted to me.

group_1.textRight: Huh…?

group_1.textLeft: I can make a miracle happen to you too,@if you so desire.

group_1.textRight: [chara:401301:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]...?!

group_1.textLeft: It surprised me, and I didn’t know what was@going on,
but what this little guy is saying is true.
That’s why, I don’t want you to throw away@your will to live.
